description: This trap signifies that the sending protocol
entity recognizes that one of the xDSL communication
links is in a fluctuating state. This is a trap of
'minor' class.

event.Summary: xDSL communication link is in fluctuating state

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the port speed of the
xDSL link has dropped below a threshold value.
This is a trap of 'warning' class

event.Summary: Speed of port is low on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the margin estimate
is below a customer set threshold value. this is a trap
of 'minor' class.

event.Summary: Margin estimate value below threshold on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the error rate estimates
is above a customer set threshold value. This is a trap
of 'minor' class.

event.Summary: Error rate estimate above threshold on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the processor detected
a bad modem set. This is a trap of 'major' class

event.Summary: Failure on port $v1 : bad modem set

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that a diagnostic test has started on one of the
ports

event.Summary: Diagnostic test started on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The RTU configured in the DSL card does NOT match with the RTU connected
to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

event.Summary: RTU type mismatch on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: A self test failure from the RTU connected
to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

event.Summary: RTU self test failure on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Card received LastGap message from SN followed by a link
down condition one minute later.

event.Summary: LastGap message received from SN on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Operating software has detected an internal device failure. The
RTU is still operating.

event.Summary: Internal device failure on SN connected to port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Failure of the RTU's hardware components. This trap is only set if the
hardware failure still allows sending traps.

event.Summary: Self test has failed on SN connected to port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: Fatal error device reset

event.Summary: SN connected to port $v1 has reset due to a fatal error

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the sending protocol
entity recognizes that the xDSL communication
link is up. LinkDownReason conveys the reason
for link down.

event.Summary: xDSL communication link is up

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This entry contains the reason as to why
the DSL Link went down. This information
is obtained when the DSL Link is coming up
variables.name: HOTWIRE-XDSL-INTERFACE-MIB::xdslLinkDownReason

description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters to SN failed
It is of warning class

event.Summary: Injection of filters to SN has failed

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The VNID Id number of the virtual network for which this entry
contains management information.
variables.name: HOT-DOMAIN-MIB::pdnPortConfigVNID

description: The value of this object corresponds to the remote
injection type
variables.name: HOTWIRE-XDSL-INTERFACE-MIB::xdslRemoteInjectionType

description: This trap signifies that the injection of filters is not supported
by the SN. It is of warning class

event.Summary: Injection of filters not supported by the SN

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The VNID Id number of the virtual network for which this entry
contains management information.
variables.name: HOT-DOMAIN-MIB::pdnPortConfigVNID

description: The value of this object corresponds to the remote
injection type
variables.name: HOTWIRE-XDSL-INTERFACE-MIB::xdslRemoteInjectionType

description: This trap is generated by an IDSL port card when it detects
that the line supplying timing signals to the chassis on the port
designated as NT has dropped. The ifIndex corresponds to the port
designated as NT.

event.Summary: Line supplying timing signals on NT port $v1 has dropped

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the port speed of the
xDSL link has has gone above the threshold value.
This is a trap of 'warning' class. This trap compliments the
xdslPortSpeedLow Trap

event.Summary: Speed is back to normal on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the margin estimate has gone
above a customer set threshold value. this is a trap
of 'minor' class. this trap compliments the xdslMarginLow
trap

event.Summary: Margin estimate is back to normal on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the error rate estimates
gone below a customer set threshold value. This is a trap
of 'minor' class. This trap compliments the xdslErrorRateHigh trap.

event.Summary: Error rate estimate is back to normal on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the modem set which was bad is now operational.
This is a trap of 'major' class. This trap compliments the
xdslPortFailure trap.

event.Summary: Port $v1 is operational

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap signifies that the test has completed on one of the
ports. This trap compliments the xdslTestStart trap.

event.Summary: Diagnostic test completed on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The RTU configured in the DSL card does match with the RTU connected
to the DSL port indicated by the ifIndex.

event.Summary: Connected RTU matches configuration on port $v1

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex
